title: Deploy a Microsoft SQL server database for OO Workflow Designer
content:
To deploy OO Workflow Designer using Microsoft SQL Server, you must have an existing SQL Server database service. If you need to create a new database service, see the relevant documentation provided by Microsoft, because this information isn't included within this section. However, this section contains recommendations for the SQL Server configuration. It's also recommended to use the SQL Server Agent service to schedule index maintenance jobs.

Workflow for Microsoft SQL Server deployment

To deploy OO Workflow Designer using Microsoft SQL Server, perform the following steps:

  1. Review sizing guidelines.
  2. Review System requirements for Microsoft SQL server database.
  3. Configure Microsoft SQL Server.
  4. Manually create an OO Workflow Designer database on Microsoft SQL Server.
  5. (Optional) Set up Windows authentication. This step is only relevant if you are using Windows authentication instead of SQL Server authentication.

Review sizing guidelines

For information to review sizing guidelines, see Set up database environment for OO Workflow Designer topic.

Review system requirement for Microsoft SQL server database

For information to review system requirements for Microsoft SQL Server database, see System requirements topic. Also, see the official Microsoft documentation for supported platforms.

Language support

In Microsoft SQL Server, unlike other databases, the OO Workflow Designer database doesn't use Unicode collation. Use one of the following collations depending on your OO Workflow Designer installation

Language Database Collation
English SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CS_AS
Japanese Japanese_Unicode_CS_AS
Simplified Chinese Chinese_Simplified_Stroke_Order_100_CS_AS
When an MS SQL database is created with a case-sensitive collation, object names such as tables, keys, and more become case-sensitive. For example, for the MY_TABLE_STEP_LOG_BINDINGS table, a command such as SELECT * FROM my_table_step_log_bindings is seen as using an invalid object name.

Configure Microsoft SQL server

This topic contains information on Microsoft SQL Server and database configuration settings. You can install an OO Workflow Designer database in any SQL Server environment including clustered environments. Legend:

  • Mandatory configuration options/values appear in bold text.
  • Recommended configuration options/values appear in bold italic font.
  • Supported configuration options/values appear in general font, and may show as a comma separated (,) list.
Microsoft SQL Server databases
Server Options/Features
Configuration Item Supported Configuration Options
Server Configuration Options Defaults, unless instructed otherwise
Instances Default, Single
Authentication Mode Mixed, Windows 1
Full-Text Search (Not required for OO Workflow Designer)
[1] At the moment, the OO Workflow Designer installer supports only SQL authentication. Windows authentication can be configured afterward.
Microsoft SQL Server databases
Instance/Server Options
Mandatory Recommended Supported
Server Collation SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CS_AS Any Collation
Network Libraries Server: TCP/IP Client: TCP/IP
Concurrent Connections >= 800 0 (unlimited)
Max Server Memory > 4GB 2,147,483,647 (default, unlimited) Allocate 4-12 GB depending on system scale
Microsoft SQL Server databases
Database Options
Mandatory Recommended Supported
Collation Any collation listed in the “Language support” in System requirements for Microsoft SQL server topic.
Recovery Model Full Simple, Full
Allow Snapshot Isolation True
Is Read Committed Snapshot On True
Auto Shrink False
Auto Create Statistics True
SQL Server doesn't use READ-COMMITTED transaction isolation by default. It's mandatory to set the Allow Snapshot Isolation and Is Read Committed Snapshot On flags. OO Workflow Designer fails to operate correctly using any other type of transaction isolation.

Manually create an OO Workflow Designer database on Microsoft SQL server

The OO Workflow Designer installation wizard gives the following options during installation:

The current release doesn't support Connect IDM service. Therefore, you'll not be able to connect to an existing IdM service or its database.
  • Create a new OO Workflow Designer database, user, and password on your chosen database server or instance.
    The current release supports only Create IDM service. You can create a new database for IdM servide from the installation wizard during the installation process.
  • Connect to an existing OO Workflow Designer database on your chosen database server or instance.

Create OO Workflow Designer database using OO Workflow Designer installation wizard

Role Location Privileges required
System administrator, Database administrator, or any user Database server using installation wizard Data Definition Language (DDL) and Data Manipulation Language (DML)

To create OO Workflow Designer database:

  1. In the Database configuration screen of the installation wizard, select Create the database/schema option.
  2. Besides the database connection details, you need to enter the desired username, password, and schema name for the Workflow Designer database.
  3. For DBA Username and password, enter the user credentials that have create database privileges. For example, sysadmin or sa.
At this point, only the database, login, and user are created. Objects such as tables and indexes get created when OO Workflow Designer starts for the first time after installation.

To connect to an existing OO Workflow Designer database:

  1. Make sure the database name and user are already created on the desired database server or instance.
  2. In the Database configuration screen of the installation wizard, select Connect to an existing database/schema option.
  3. Enter the existing database name and user credentials to establish a connection. For example, oodesignerdb and oodesignerdbuser.

Create OO Workflow Designer database using the Microsoft SQL database server

Role Location Privileges required
Database administrator or any user Database server using installation wizard DDL and DML

If you're an authorized user with elevated privileges to create a new OO Workflow Designer database but don't wish to create OO database using the installation wizard. Then you may request your organization's database administrator to create an OO Workflow Designer database and the user name of your choice. After the database administrator creates the OO Workflow Designer database and user for you with the required permission, you can then connect to an existing database using basic privileges.

Review the following general notes for a database administrator:

  • Members of the sysadmin server roles automatically have CREATE DATABASE permission and are also mapped to dbo in all databases.
  • Perform the create database procedures only if you are an experienced Microsoft SQL Server database administrator.
  • If you prefer to use the database creation wizard/GUI, make sure you select all options that correspond with the T-SQL code presented below. For example, make sure you set Allow Snapshot Isolation to TRUE under the Options page/Other Options pane/Miscellaneous tab in the New Database dialog box.
    Selecting a specific collation also means that an OO Workflow Designer system that uses SQL Server is limited to the set of languages supported by that specific collation. For example, if the SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CS_AS collation is used, English, German, and Spanish characters may be used, but Japanese characters may not. If Japanese_Unicode_CS_AS is used, French accent characters won't be presented correctly. For the complete specification of each collation, see the Microsoft SQL Server documentation.
  • Not all database creation options are specified—only those that differ from the default value. When in doubt, use default values.

To create a database on the Microsoft SQL server:

  1. You can use the create database scripts from:
    1. The downloaded and extracted installation zip at: <oo_version>\config\sql\Designer\MS-SQL
    2. The downloaded and extracted database scripts from ITOM Marketplace at: OO_Database_Creation\Designer\MS-SQL
  2. Log in to Microsoft SQL Server using sa or any other login with a sysadmin role or the CREATE DATABASE permission. 
  3. Navigate to the create database script from the extracted zip packages at: <oo_version>\config\sql\Designer\MS-SQL, or OO_Database_Creation\Designer\MS-SQL
  4. Edit and run the create database script mssql_create_wd_db.sql and then verify that the database, login, and user were created successfully. You may have to adapt the script parameters to match your environment. 
  5. (Optional) To verify that the database objects can be created by the new login and user:
    1. Connect to the Microsoft SQL database server.
    2. Log in using the OO Workflow Designer’s newly created login role credentials.
    3. Navigate to the database test script from the extracted zip packages at: <oo_version>\config\sql\Designer\MS-SQL, or OO_Database_Creation\Designer\MS-SQL
    4. Run the database test script mssql_create_test_table.sql and then verify that the script ran correctly without any errors or warnings.

Additional guidelines for Microsoft SQL server

This topic contains additional guidelines relevant for OO Workflow Designer deployment on Microsoft SQL Server.

Configure OO Workflow Designer to work with Windows authentication

Unless configured otherwise, OO Workflow Designer uses Microsoft SQL Server authentication to access Microsoft SQL Server databases. Note that the OO Workflow Designer installer currently doesn't support Windows authentication usage during the installation. However, you can configure Windows authentication after installing the OO Workflow Designer.

To enable OO Workflow Designer to use Windows authentication to access a Microsoft SQL database, you must perform required setup steps on:

  • The service
  • The database

In case you have a deployment where you used the option "Create IDM " for authentication, the IDM service can also be configured to connect to the IDM database using Windows Authentication.  If you use Workflow Designer connecting to another installed IDM service ( “IDM connect” mode), then you can skip the steps that are documented for IDM configuration.

You must ensure the following database configurations are completed:

  • The Windows user is added and able to login to the SQL Server
  • This user is made as an owner of the databases that you wish to configure with Windows Authentication (OO Workflow Designer and IDM)
  • Set dbo as the default schema on Workflow Designer and IDM databases for that Windows user

The following configuration steps must be followed for OO Workflow Designer and IDM (if created):

  1. Copy the sqljdbc_auth.dll to the installation path of the OO Workflow Designer in designer/bin . The sqljdbc_auth.dll can be downloaded from the Microsoft site through the JDBC package driver version 7.4.1. For more details, see the Microsoft JDBC documentation.
  2. Configure the Workflow Designer service to run under the same Windows account that you set up to own the database.
  3. Back up your current database.properties file located under <OO Workflow Designer installation>/designer/conf and edit the file by changing only the relevant parameters to match the following example:
    For the db.username, the backslashes must be escaped (\\)
    For the db.password, you can leave as is, since the credentials will be used from the service.
    When copying scripts, note that you may need to remove redundant line breaks from the copied version.
    db.username=[DOMAIN_NAME]\\[USERNAME]
jdbc.url=jdbc\:sqlserver\://[DB_HOSTNAME]\:[PORT];databaseName\=[DB_NAME];sendStringParametersAsUnicode\=true;integratedSecurity\=true

  4. Additionally, for the IDM service (created with Workflow Designer), perform the following steps:

    1. Backup and edit the IdM configuration file named applicationContext.properties, located under <Designer installation>/designer/tomcat/webapps/idm-service/WEB-INF/spring and change only the relevant parameters to match: 
      idm.persistence.connection.username=[DOMAIN_NAME]\\[USERNAME]
idm.persistence.connection.url - add to the existing url the parameter ;integratedSecurity\=true

    2. Backup to another folder and then delete the 2 JDBC drivers from the idm-service: mssql-jdbc-7.0.0.jre8.jar and mssql-jdbc-7.4.1.jre8.jar, that are located under the folder <Designer Installation>/designer/tomcat/webapps/idm-service/WEB-INF/lib.

Configure OO Workflow Designer to work with Always On

OO Workflow Designer connects to SQL Server databases using the Microsoft JDBC 7.4.1 connector.

The following is an example on how to format JDBC URL to connect to an Always On cluster:

jdbc.url=jdbc\:sqlserver\://[AG-NET-NAME]\:[port];instanceName\=[NAMED-INST-NAME];
databaseName\=[DB-NAME];multiSubnetFailover\=true;applicationIntent\=ReadWrite;
sendStringParametersAsUnicode\=true

The multiSubnetFailover and applicationIntent properties are added to allow more complex behaviors. 

As OO Workflow Designer requires a single point of contact, it's essential that an Availability Group Listener (AG listener) exists in the High Availability setup.

The Workflow Designer’s database connection is defined by a single URL - containing a single hostname and interfaces with the AG listener to connect to the availability group primary replica (a READ-WRITE capable instance).

In the case of a database failover scenario, while database connectivity is lost, OO Workflow Designer will make attempts to connect to the database until a new READ-WRITE capable instance accepts the connection.

The redirection of the configured database hostname to a different IP address should be done by the AG Listener and the cluster environment.

The Multi-Subnet Failover scenarios in conjunction with SQL Server Always On cluster weren't certified with OO Workflow Designer.

For additional information and connection options, refer to the Microsoft JDBC documentation.
